subject: p11569042
History: Achalasia, status post NG tube placement into esophagus. Please confirm NG tube in esophagus.
Findings: Nasogastric catheter is seen coursing through the dilated esophagus, consistent with achalasia, and appears to terminate in the esophagus at the level of the posterior costophrenic sulcus. Otherwise, the exam is unchanged with unremarkable mediastinal, hilar and cardiac contours. Lungs are clear. No pleural effusion or pneumothorax is evident.
Impression: Enteric catheter coursing through dilated esophagus, ending in the distal esophagus at the level of the right posterior costophrenic angle.
